Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery hydria; exterior: black figure decoration consisting of siren to left (part of wing, one leg and part of the other; part of body with dab in added red, and tail with dots in added white and red and white strokes on feathers remaining); above at right, part of undetermined black object with brown outline; below figure, brown band then reserved band above glazed area with four narrow red bands..
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 131, no. 8)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 88, pl. X, no. 20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.046) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
